form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Casey (for himself and Mr. Toomey) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Gettysburg and the significance of this battle in the history of the United States.

whereas.text: Whereas the Battle of Gettysburg was the battle with the largest number of casualties in the American Civil War;
Whereas over 3,500 soldiers were buried at the Soldiers' National Cemetery after losing their lives in the battle;
Whereas the Gettysburg battlefield was designated as a National Military Park in 1895;
Whereas the residents of Gettysburg helped to preserve the land that now serves as the Gettysburg National Military Park, including the Soldiers' National Cemetery and the Gettysburg battlefield; and
Whereas more than 1,000,000 people travel each year to visit the park, museum, and visitor center: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: recognizes the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Gettysburg;
recognizes the historical significance of the outcome of the Battle of Gettysburg, which helped to preserve the United States; and
encourages the people of the United States to visit Gettysburg National Military Park to celebrate and commemorate the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Gettysburg.
